head.title: National Briefing | South: Florida: Battle Over Inmates Ends

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Florida: Battle Over Inmates Ends

abstract.p: Florida state Judge Robert J Morris Jr dismisses contempt of court charges and $80,000 in fines against Florida Department of Children and Families and its former secretary, ending court battle over handling of dozens of mentally ill inmates who have been housed in county jails while waiting for state hospital beds (S)

block.p: A state judge dismissed contempt of court charges and $80,000 in fines against the Florida Department of Children and Families and its former secretary, ending a court battle over the handling of dozens of mentally ill inmates who have been housed in county jails while waiting for state hospital beds. The judge, Robert J. Morris Jr. of Pasco-Pinellas Circuit Court, dismissed the case after the new secretary, Bob Butterworth, disclosed a plan to create 373 new state hospital beds by June 30.
